data.text:
What is a Cloud Service?

A cloud service is any service made available to users on demand via the Internet from a cloud computing provider’s servers as opposed to being provided from a company’s own on-premises servers.

Cloud services are designed to provide easy, scalable access to applications, resources and services, and are fully managed by a cloud service provider.

Types of Cloud Services:

Software as a Service(SaaS)

Platform as a Service(PaaS)

Infrastructure as a Service(IaaS)

Security as a Service(SECaaS)

Mobile Backend as a Service(MBaaS)

Data as a Service

Everything as a Service

Hardware as a Service

Workplace as a Service

The most commonly known cloud services are Software as a Service(SaaS), Platform as a Service(PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service(IaaS). We’ll be posting details of every service and which service provider provides which service.

Top Cloud Service Providers:

Amazon Web Services

Amazon Drive

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

Amazon ElastiCache

Microsoft Azure

Google Cloud Platform

Adobe Marketing Cloud

VMware

Cisco

IBM Cloud

Rackspace

HP

Red Hat

Salesforce

Oracle Cloud

JoyentCloud

SAP

Verizon Cloud

NaviSite

Dropbox

Egnyte

Workday

ServiceNow

Cloud providers are sometimes referred to as cloud service providers or CSPs. Just to clear some confusion about the terms being switched.
